channel.title: Installing Linux[HELP]
channel.description:
Alright, so first I had an error that wouldn't find the OS or something but I had to plug it into the internet first. Then I plugged it in. I got the
[code]CLINT MAC ADDR: ## ## ## ## ## ## GUID: ########-####-####-####-############ PXE-E53: No boot filename received
PXE-M0F: Exiting PXE ROM. Operating System not found[/code]
After that, it tried to do the whole process again.

item.title: Installing Linux[HELP]
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“cocoa, post:1, topic:273792”]Alright, so first I had an error that wouldn’t find the OS or something but I had to plug it into the internet first. Then I plugged it in. I got the

[code]CLINT MAC ADDR: ## ## ## ## ## ## GUID: ########-####-####-####-############
PXE-E53: No boot filename received

PXE-M0F: Exiting PXE ROM.
Operating System not found[/code]

After that, it tried to do the whole process again.[/quote]

That is a BIOS thing, not a linux thing. You need to get to your boot menu or your bios to change the boot order. Imgburn is free and what you want to use to burn an iso in windows, but alternatively you can install ubuntu in windows just like a windows program using WUBI, it is probably the easiest way to go for a new person.

Read full topic

item.title: Installing Linux[HELP]
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Did you burn the ISO correctly to the disc.
You dont simply dump it in Windows Explorer.
You need to burn disc as image with a program like Alcohol 120%, Magic ISO, ImgBurn (Probably the best) or Nero.

edit:

You need a registered version of Magic ISO to burn an image > 300mb and Ubuntu is ~600-700mb. You will need to get it unofficailly if you know what i mean.

Read full topic

item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:6, topic:273792”]Wait, your on an OEM machine so the button is different.
Are there any prompts of keys when you boot?

On my pc it is F2.[/quote]
Ya, I got it already. It was F2.

Is there supposed to be anything on the linux disk other than the ISO?

Read full topic

item.title: Installing Linux[HELP]
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Change your Boot order in your BIOS (press delete at startup.)
Put your DVD/CD Drive before your network.

Then save the settings and re-boot. Make sure you have your Ubuntu CD in the drive before you re-boot.

Read full topic
